item.title: Cut Through the Noise: XDR’s Key to Exposing Real Threats with Correlated Context
item.description:
XDR (Extended Detection and Response) isn’t a silver bullet — it’s the glue that turns isolated alerts into a single, actionable incident by correlating telemetry across email, endpoint, and network. This reduces time-to-detection and enables faster containment.

Context First: Making XDR Actionable
#

In my first post, I wrote about arriving in the SOC and learning that real threats rarely appear as textbook CVEs. Often, the biggest risk is not a clever zero-day — it’s noise: dozens of isolated alerts with no shared context.

item.title: Beyond EDR: Why Your Cybersecurity Strategy Is Failing
item.description:
At my last job, I heard a phrase that stopped me in my tracks:

“Everything is fine. We have an EDR solution, and we’ve never had an incident.”

This statement sounded reassuring on the surface, but the reality was dangerously different.

The True Scope of Responsibility
#

As a support engineer, my role extends far beyond “fixing machines” or “blocking emails.” My core mission is to ensure the operational continuity of the entire organization. This means every workstation, server, peripheral, and application must function as a cohesive, well-oiled part of a larger system.
